title: Act 2023 (No. 39 of 2023)) of the Finance Act 1989 (No. 10 of 1989) (as adapted
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Disabled Drivers and Disabled
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Disabled Drivers and Disabled 

Passengers (Tax Concessions) (Amendment) Regulations 2025.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited disabled driver disabled passenger (tax concessions) (amendment) regulation 2025

title: Act 2023 (No. 39 of 2023)) of the Finance Act 1989 (No. 10 of 1989) (as adapted
heading: 2. Regulation 6(1) of the Disabled Drivers and Disabled Passengers (Tax
text_raw:
2. Regulation 6(1) of the Disabled Drivers and Disabled Passengers (Tax 

Concessions) Regulations 1994 (S.I. No. 353 of 1994) is amended – 

(a) 

in subparagraph (a), by the substitution of “minimum of 4 medical 
practitioners” for “minimum of 5 medical practitioners”, and 

(b) by the substitution of the following paragraph for paragraph (da): 

(i) Notwithstanding subparagraph (a), where a 
“(da) 
vacancy on the Board causes the number of medical practitioners 
standing appointed to the Board to fall below 4, subject to clause 
(ii), the Board may, while the number of medical practitioners 
standing so appointed remains below 4, continue to exercise the 
functions of the Board for a period of not longer than 12 months 
from the date such vacancy first arises. 

(ii) Where a vacancy on the Board causes there to be 

fewer than – 

(I) 

3 medical practitioners at any time, or 

(II) 4 medical practitioners at the end of the 
period of 12 months referred to in clause 
(i), 

standing appointed to the Board, the Board shall cease to exercise 
its functions until such time as not fewer than 4 medical 
practitioners stand so appointed.”. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 16th September, 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [428] 3 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

10 September, 2025. 

PASCHAL DONOHOE, 
Minister for Finance. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [428]
